sen.j: 道摩法師（どうまほうし）は平安時代、一条天皇の頃の大呪術師。
sen.e: Doma hoshi was a great magician who lived during the Heian period, in the reign of Emperor Ichijo.
Doma hoshi was a great magician who lived during the Heian period, in the reign of the Emperor Ichijo.
sen.cmt: "Emperor Ichijo"→"the"を付けました。（用語統一リスト）
sen.e: Doma hoshi was a great magician who lived during the Heian period, in the reign of the Emperor Ichijo.

sen.j: 江戸時代の地誌『播磨鑑』によると播磨国岸村(現兵庫県加古川市西神吉町岸)の出身とされる。
sen.e: According to "Harima Kagami" (the history of Harima Province) which was a topography of the Edo Period, he was from Kishimura of the Harima Province (present day Nishikankicho kishi, Kakogawa City, Hyogo Prefecture).

According to "Harima Kagami" (the history of Harima Province) which was a topography of the Edo Period, he was from Kishi village in the Harima Province (present day Nishikankicho Kishi, Kakogawa City, Hyogo Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「岸村」→歴史的な場所なので"○○village"としました。（用語統一リスト）
sen.e: According to "Harima Kagami" (the history of Harima Province) which was a topography of the Edo Period, he was from Kishi village in the Harima Province (present day Nishikankicho Kishi, Kakogawa City, Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: 陰陽道の祖とされる安倍晴明とライバル関係にあり、式神対決で晴明に敗れ、播磨国へ追放された。
sen.e: He was in rivalry with ABE no Seimei who was considered as the founder of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), and because he was defeated by Seimei in Shiki gami Taiketsu (fighting against the fierce god which behaves in accordance with Onmyoji, who were masters of Yin and Yang), he was deported to Harima Province.

He was in rivalry with ABE no Seimei who was considered as the founder of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), and because he was defeated by Seimei in a fight using shikigami (fierce god which behaves in accordance with Onmyoji, who were masters of Yin and Yang), he was deported to Harima Province.
sen.cmt: 「式神対決」→一般的な単語なので、ローマ字表記する必要はないと思います。また、"fighting against the fierce god"だと、「式神と戦う」意味になりますが、この対決は術比べ、「式神を使った二人の対決」だと思います。
sen.e: He was in rivalry with ABE no Seimei who was considered as the founder of Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements), and because he was defeated by Seimei in a fight using shikigami (fierce god which behaves in accordance with Onmyoji, who were masters of Yin and Yang), he was deported to Harima Province.

sen.j: 一般的には、蘆屋道満（あしや どうまん、蘆屋は芦屋とも書く）として知られる安倍晴明のライバル。
sen.e: Generally, he was known as Doman ASHIYA ('蘆屋' (Ashiya) was otherwise written as '芦屋') who was a rival of ABE no Seimei.
Generally, he is known as Doman ASHIYA (蘆屋 [Ashiya] is otherwise written as 芦屋) who was a rival of ABE no Seimei.
Generally, he is known as Doman ASHIYA (蘆屋 [Ashiya] is otherwise written as 芦屋) who was a rival of ABE no Seimei.

sen.j: 晴明に勝るとも劣らないほどの呪術力を持つ。
sen.e: He had power of jujutsu (an occult art) in no way inferior to that of Seimei.
He had power of jujutsu (an occult art) in no way inferior to that of Seimei.
He had power of jujutsu (an occult art) in no way inferior to that of Seimei.

sen.j: 安倍晴明が藤原道長お抱えの陰陽師であったのに対し、蘆屋道満は藤原顕光お抱えの陰陽師であった。
sen.e: While ABE no Seimei was an Onmyoji who was employed by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Doman ASHIYA was an Onmyoji who was employed by FUJIWARA no Akimitsu.
While ABE no Seimei was an Onmyoji who was employed by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Doman ASHIYA was an Onmyoji who was employed by FUJIWARA no Akimitsu.
While ABE no Seimei was an Onmyoji who was employed by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Doman ASHIYA was an Onmyoji who was employed by FUJIWARA no Akimitsu.

sen.j: また、道摩法師と蘆屋道満は別人であるという説も存在する。
sen.e: Also, there is a theory that regards Doma hoshi and Doman ASHIYA to be different men.
Also, there is a theory that regards Doma Hoshi and Doman ASHIYA to be different men.
sen.cmt: 「道摩法師」→各語の頭文字は大文字にしました。
sen.e: Also, there is a theory that regards Doma Hoshi and Doman ASHIYA to be different men.

sen.j: 安部の『金烏玉兎集』を盗写したという伝説は、のちに浄瑠璃、歌舞伎に脚色された。
sen.e: A folklore that told Doma hoshi copying ABE's "Kinugyokutoshu" was later dramatized for Joruri (Ballad drama) and Kabuki.
A folklore about Doma hoshi secretly copying Abe's "Kinugyokutoshu" (the book of secrets of Onmyodo) was later dramatized for Joruri (ballad drama) and Kabuki.
sen.cmt: "that told"→次にくるのが名詞節なので"about"に修正しました。「盗写」→"secretly"を挿入しました。『金烏玉兎集』→陰陽道の秘伝書。説明を入れました。
sen.e: A folklore about Doma hoshi secretly copying Abe's "Kinugyokutoshu" (the book of secrets of Onmyodo) was later dramatized for Joruri (ballad drama) and Kabuki.
